topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fb7f63687223a3d60d00#post_5571fb7f63687223a3d60d00
I would argue that it should be done if the creator wants it to be that way, other wise it is in fact imposing views. If done by free will any message trying to be shown will probably come across more because the creator is more enthusiastic to tell it.

!http://livingmythmagazine.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Kamala-Khan-01.jpg!

Kamala Khan. Muslim teenaged ms Marvel. Good character. Done totally of free will by a muslim woman who wanted to tell this story. Can make young girls feel included in the comic community (yes children...come. Come and worship with me at the shrine of comicsdom)

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fd50636872028cf30100#post_5571fd50636872028cf30100
That is what I would label as a more poor example of diversity. Pointing out "Look she's a girl!".

...that and that it seems to follow every romantic comedy cliche ever (personal gripe), will confirm this when I watch pilot. 

Though I suppose an arguement could be made that maybe you need that approach to attract a different audience.The show seems to be targeted to a female audience so it makes sense that they'd go that route. Even if its....irritating.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fca663687279f62f1400#post_5571fca663687279f62f1400
The idea of my rules is for people like me who grow up in a bubble to help notice when they are omitting people out of habit, lots of writers would be fine with having a black man as the lawyer confidant of a super hero but may never even think of it because on a sub conscious level we all tend towards certain perceived norms, that's what the 3 questions are meant to address,

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fe7f6368725f29372100#post_5571fe7f6368725f29372100
[bq="Carcass Strife"]For fucks sake, people, can't you shut up and move on?[/bq]
To be fair we're not the ones that started it.  Thanotos has essentially become a kool-aid salesman and *EVERY SINGLE FUCKING CHANCE HE GETS HE TRIES TO INDOCTRINATE PEOPLE NOW!*

Random person, "Oh hey; I really like Avengers 2"
Thanotos, "*knock knock* Have you heard the good word of our savior Anita?"
"Fuck off; we're not interested *slams door*"
. . .
Random person, "I really like this comic book"
Thanotos, "*knock knock* Have you heard the good news of our savior and lord Anita?"
"I said fuck off *tries to close door*"
Thanotos, "*puts head through door* Please sir; it would only take a minute"
"No; we're not interested"
Thanotos, "Please; if you would just take a moment to hear the good word"

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fef563687279f6051900#post_5571fef563687279f6051900
From what I've noticed when you grow up a around a group of people, you tend to make the characters of your story what is normal to you. Probably the reason white people usually make white characters. Which is not bad by any means if you ask me.

Again though I would argue that the creator should feel a desire to make a different race character. Otherwise it could very well be crap cause they feel forced and are unininspired.

Again. Miles Morales. Bendis wanted to make Miles (also it helps hes a good writer...ussually), he crafted a good backstory, a good cast, and potential for new stories with Miles. Not once did he point out "Look! he's Black!" He just let the stories about the character be told.

In my opinion that's a good way to do diversity. Just. Tell. A good. Story.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1
